p: Another polyphenol source is olive pomace [ 65], a by-product of the olive oil supply chain. This matrix is rich in tyrosol and its derivatives, and it also contains flavonoids such as rutin, apigenin, luteolin, taxifolin, diosmetin, and quercetin, and phenolic acids such as cinnamic, p-coumaric, caffeic, vanillic, and ferulic acid [ 66, 67]. Due to its polyphenol content, olive pomace is also added to ruminant feed [ 68].
